headline.main: The Filthy Streets--Another Card From Mr. Genin.
Inauguration of the Mayor of Philadelphia.

docs.lead_paragraph: An immense crowd assembly in Independence-square to-day, to witness the inauguration of Mayor CONRAD. After taking the oath of office, the Mayor commenced delivering an inaugural speech, in the mid at of which he was interrupted by a tremendous shower. A great portion of the crowd fled to the vestibule of the Hall, and the Mayor took his position on the stair-way to finish his speech.

headline.main: LONG ISLAND.; BROOKLYN BOARD OF HEALTH THE ARSON CASE. MOVEMENT TO PRESERVE THE PEACE IN BROOKLYN. KINGS COUNTY GRAND JURY.

docs.lead_paragraph: BROOKLYN BOARD OF HEALTH.--THE CHOLERA.--This Board assembled yesterday, Mayor LAMBERT in the Chair. The following notice was adopted: Whereas, It is rumored that the cholera exists in out city--Now, therefore, in order to allay any undue excitement, physicians are requested to report form with every case and locality to this office, so that our fellow citizens may have full and satisfactory information on the subject.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Washington Star. We regret to have to state that this efficient officer is confined to his lodgings, in this city, by very severe indisposition. Col. MONEYPENNY, after being for years accustomed to a life wherein he was compelled to take much bodily exercise, has been very closely confined, indeed, ever since taking charge of the Indian Buicau.

docs.lead_paragraph: A young man named A. G. Champ, formerly of Pittsburg, committed suicide by hanging, at the Sault, on Sunday night last. He had been employed to act an clerk to the National Mine, on Lake Superior, and went up the Lake to Ontonagon with the intention of landing at that port. but the state of the weather was such as to prevent the boat from touching there, and he returned to the Sault.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have dates from Havana to June 8. There is no news of importance, n?? contained in the letter of our regular correspondent. Correspondence from Spain to the Diario de la Marina dilates upon the proposed augmentation of the Spanish forces in Cuba, without stating any particular facts, although the promise of performance is large.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE ARABIA. WAR NEWS NOT IMPORTANT. MOVEMENTS ABOUT SILISTRIA. CHANGE IN BRITISH CABINET. THE GREEK DIFFICULTY SETTLED. Markets--Rise in Funds--Cotton Higher Grain and Flour Bull.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Cunard mail steamer Arabia, from Liverpool Saturday, June 3, at 1 P. M., arrived at this port last evening at 8 1/2 o'clock. The Pacific sailed from Liverpool Wednesday, May 31, at 1:30 P. M. The U. S. mail steamer Washington arrived off Cowes on Friday morning, and proceeded to destination.

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN PERU.; History of the Revelution--Recent Movements-General Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: My last letter to the TIMES was dated at Panama, from whence I sailed on 22d April, in the slow steamship Valdivia, for Callao, which was ten days and-a-half en voyage. On a good steamer the trip could be made in four days without stoppages, or in five days, touching at Guayaquil, Paita,
